intro: Betula alnus var. crispa, commonly known as the crested birch, is a variant of the European white birch. It is characterized by its distinctive, curled leaves that give it a unique, ornamental appearance. The plant is a deciduous tree or shrub native to northern Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters and has smooth, white bark that peels in thin layers. The leaves are ovate to elliptic, with serrated edges and a pale underside, contributing to its visual appeal in gardens.
